title: Thutmose III ascends to the throne of Egypt, although power effectively shifts to Hatshepsut (according to the Low Chronology of the 18th dynasty).
text: redirect" title="1479 BC">1479 BC – Thutmose III ascends to the throne of Egypt, although power effectively shifts to Hatshepsut (according to the Low Chronology of the 18th dynasty).

title: Traditional date of the fall of Troy.
text: redirect" title="1184 BC">1184 BC – Traditional date of the fall of Troy.

title: Battle of Mühlberg. Duke of Alba, commanding Spanish-Imperial forces of Charles I of Spain, defeats the troops of Schmalkaldic League.
text: Battle of Mühlberg. Duke of Alba, commanding Spanish-Imperial forces of Charles I of Spain, defeats the troops of Schmalkaldic League.

title: Mary, Queen of Scots, marries the Dauphin of France, François, at Notre Dame de Paris.
text: Mary, Queen of Scots, marries the Dauphin of France, François, at Notre Dame de Paris.

title: The first regular newspaper in British Colonial America, The Boston News-Letter, is published.
text: The first regular newspaper in British Colonial America, The Boston News-Letter, is published.

title: The United States Library of Congress is established when President John Adams signs legislation to appropriate $5,000 to purchase "such books as may be necessary for the use of Congress".
text: The United States Library of Congress is established when President John Adams signs legislation to appropriate $5,000 to purchase "such books as may be necessary for the use of Congress".

title: Russo-Turkish War: Russian Empire declares war on Ottoman Empire.
text: Russo-Turkish War: Russian Empire declares war on Ottoman Empire.

title: American sharpshooter Annie Oakley is hired by Nate Salsbury to be a part of Buffalo Bill's Wild West.
text: American sharpshooter Annie Oakley is hired by Nate Salsbury to be a part of Buffalo Bill's Wild West.

title: Joshua Slocum, the first person to sail single-handedly around the world, sets sail from Boston, Massachusetts aboard the sloop "Spray".
text: Joshua Slocum, the first person to sail single-handedly around the world, sets sail from Boston, Massachusetts aboard the sloop "Spray".

title: The Woolworth Building, a skyscraper in New York City, is opened.
text: The Woolworth Building, a skyscraper in New York City, is opened.

title: The Franck–Hertz experiment, a pillar of quantum mechanics, is presented to the German Physical Society.
text: The Franck–Hertz experiment, a pillar of quantum mechanics, is presented to the German Physical Society.

title: The arrest of 250 Armenian intellectuals and community leaders in Istanbul marks the beginning of the Armenian Genocide.
text: The arrest of 250 Armenian intellectuals and community leaders in Istanbul marks the beginning of the Armenian Genocide.

title: Easter Rising: Irish rebels, led by Patrick Pearse and James Connolly, launch an uprising in Dublin against British rule and proclaim an Irish Republic.
text: Easter Rising: Irish rebels, led by Patrick Pearse and James Connolly, launch an uprising in Dublin against British rule and proclaim an Irish Republic.

title: Ernest Shackleton and five men of the Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition launch a lifeboat from uninhabited Elephant Island in the Southern Ocean to organise a rescue for the crew of the sunken Endurance.
text: Ernest Shackleton and five men of the Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition launch a lifeboat from uninhabited Elephant Island in the Southern Ocean to organise a rescue for the crew of the sunken Endurance.

title: World War I: First tank-to-tank combat, during the second Battle of Villers-Bretonneux. Three British Mark IVs meet three German A7Vs.
text: World War I: First tank-to-tank combat, during the second Battle of Villers-Bretonneux. Three British Mark IVs meet three German A7Vs.

title: The first segment of the Imperial Wireless Chain providing wireless telegraphy between Leafield in Oxfordshire, England, and Cairo, Egypt, comes into operation.
text: The first segment of the Imperial Wireless Chain providing wireless telegraphy between Leafield in Oxfordshire, England, and Cairo, Egypt, comes into operation.

title: In Vienna, the paper Das Ich und das Es (The Ego and the Id) by Sigmund Freud is published, which outlines Freud's theories of the id, ego, and super-ego.
text: In Vienna, the paper Das Ich und das Es (The Ego and the Id) by Sigmund Freud is published, which outlines Freud's theories of the id, ego, and super-ego.

title: The Treaty of Berlin is signed. Germany and the Soviet Union each pledge neutrality in the event of an attack on the other by a third party for the next five years.
text: The Treaty of Berlin is signed. Germany and the Soviet Union each pledge neutrality in the event of an attack on the other by a third party for the next five years.

title: Benny Rothman leads the mass trespass of Kinder Scout, leading to substantial legal reforms in the United Kingdom.
text: Benny Rothman leads the mass trespass of Kinder Scout, leading to substantial legal reforms in the United Kingdom.

title: Nazi Germany begins its persecution of Jehovah's Witnesses by shutting down the Watch Tower Society office in Magdeburg.
text: Nazi Germany begins its persecution of Jehovah's Witnesses by shutting down the Watch Tower Society office in Magdeburg.

title: World War II: The SBS launches a raid against the garrison of Santorini in Greece.
text: World War II: The SBS launches a raid against the garrison of Santorini in Greece.

title: Winston Churchill is knighted by Queen Elizabeth II.
text: Winston Churchill is knighted by Queen Elizabeth II.

title: The Bandung Conference ends: Twenty-nine non-aligned nations of Asia and Africa finish a meeting that condemns colonialism, racism, and the Cold War.
text: The Bandung Conference ends: Twenty-nine non-aligned nations of Asia and Africa finish a meeting that condemns colonialism, racism, and the Cold War.

title: Suez Crisis: The Suez Canal is reopened following the introduction of UNEF peacekeepers to the region.
text: Suez Crisis: The Suez Canal is reopened following the introduction of UNEF peacekeepers to the region.

title: Marriage of HRH Princess Alexandra of Kent to the Hon Angus Ogilvy at Westminster Abbey in London.
text: Marriage of HRH Princess Alexandra of Kent to the Hon Angus Ogilvy at Westminster Abbey in London.

title: Civil war breaks out in the Dominican Republic when Colonel Francisco Caamaño, overthrows the triumvirate that had been in power since the coup d'état against Juan Bosch.
text: Civil war breaks out in the Dominican Republic when Colonel Francisco Caamaño, overthrows the triumvirate that had been in power since the coup d'état against Juan Bosch.

title: Cosmonaut Vladimir Komarov dies in Soyuz 1 when its parachute fails to open. He is the first human to die during a space mission.
text: Cosmonaut Vladimir Komarov dies in Soyuz 1 when its parachute fails to open. He is the first human to die during a space mission.

title: Vietnam War: American General William Westmoreland says in a news conference that the enemy had "gained support in the United States that gives him hope that he can win politically that which he cannot win militarily."
text: Vietnam War: American General William Westmoreland says in a news conference that the enemy had "gained support in the United States that gives him hope that he can win politically that which he cannot win militarily."

title: The Gambia becomes a republic within the Commonwealth of Nations, with Dawda Jawara as its first President.
text: The Gambia becomes a republic within the Commonwealth of Nations, with Dawda Jawara as its first President.

title: Eight U.S. servicemen die in Operation Eagle Claw as they attempt to end the Iran hostage crisis.
text: Eight U.S. servicemen die in Operation Eagle Claw as they attempt to end the Iran hostage crisis.

title: STS-31: The Hubble Space Telescope is launched from the Space Shuttle Discovery.
text: STS-31: The Hubble Space Telescope is launched from the Space Shuttle Discovery.

title: Gruinard Island, Scotland, is officially declared free of the anthrax disease after 48 years of quarantine.
text: Gruinard Island, Scotland, is officially declared free of the anthrax disease after 48 years of quarantine.

title: An IRA bomb devastates the Bishopsgate area of London.
text: An IRA bomb devastates the Bishopsgate area of London.

title: In the United States, the Antiterrorism and Effective Death Penalty Act of 1996 is passed into law.
text: In the United States, the Antiterrorism and Effective Death Penalty Act of 1996 is passed into law.

title: The United States lifts economic sanctions imposed on Libya 18 years previously, as a reward for its cooperation in eliminating weapons of mass destruction.
text: The United States lifts economic sanctions imposed on Libya 18 years previously, as a reward for its cooperation in eliminating weapons of mass destruction.

title: Cardinal Joseph Ratzinger is inaugurated as the 265th Pope of the Catholic Church taking the name Pope Benedict XVI.
text: Cardinal Joseph Ratzinger is inaugurated as the 265th Pope of the Catholic Church taking the name Pope Benedict XVI.

title: A building collapses near Dhaka, Bangladesh, killing 1,129 people and injuring 2,500 others.
text: A building collapses near Dhaka, Bangladesh, killing 1,129 people and injuring 2,500 others.

title: Violence in Bachu County, Kashgar Prefecture, of China's Xinjiang results in death of 21 people.
text: Violence in Bachu County, Kashgar Prefecture, of China's Xinjiang results in death of 21 people.
